usa: Women's suffrage and civil rights activist Susan B. Anthony died.<sup id="cite_ref-20" class="reference">[20]</sup>

The 1906 San Francisco earthquake killed over 3,400 people and destroyed over 80% of San Francisco; being the deadliest earthquake in American history.<sup id="cite_ref-21" class="reference">[21]</sup><sup id="cite_ref-22" class="reference">[22]</sup><sup id="cite_ref-23" class="reference">[23]</sup>
The Hepburn Act was signed into law.<sup id="cite_ref-24" class="reference">[24]</sup>

The Pure Food and Drug Act and Meat Inspection Act were signed; establishing the Food and Drug Administration (FDA).<sup id="cite_ref-25" class="reference">[25]</sup><sup id="cite_ref-26" class="reference">[26]</sup>

President Theodore Roosevelt was awarded the Nobel Peace Prize for his role in negotiating the end of the Russo-Japanese war; becoming the first statesman to win a Nobel Prize.<sup id="cite_ref-27" class="reference">[27]</sup>
